projects.name: 1.3.02 Schoolchildren in vulnerable areas have improved food security, nutrition and learning results through a sustainable national school meals programme by 2026 (WFP CSP SO 1)
projects.description: The project will support programmes in 2241 schools in 18 of the 40 MoES priority districts through the provision of school meals, WASH, community mobilization, infrastructure investments, literacy, agriculture support, policy support, government capacity strengthening and health and nutrition interventions.

projects.name: Vulnerable people at risk of any form of malnutrition, in particular women and girls of reproductive agen, children under 5 and school-age children, have improved nutrition outcomes in line with natio
projects.description: WFP aims to reduce all forms of malnutrition among vulnerable groups in rural areas by providing universally accessible nutrition support services for targeted populations and nutrition-related technical assistance, advocacy and evidence-based advice to the Government and other stakeholders, including in the private sector. Activities under this strategic outcome will also serve the population overall through strengthened government capacity to design, implement and partner for multisectoral nut

projects.name: 1.2.09 Leadership and technical support
projects.description: Technical and secretariat support provided by WHO Country Officen in Lao PDR to ensure that people in Lao PDR  benefit from universal health coverage without financial hardship, are better protected from health emergencies and enjoy better health and well-being

projects.name: 4.3.18 Vulnerable people in disaster-affected or at risk areas have enhanced food and nutrition security all year (WFP CSP SO 3)
projects.description: Vulnerable people in disaster-affected or at-risk areas have enhanced food and nutrition security all year round and increased capacity to mitigate and manage risks associated with climate and other shocks by 2026. This will be achieved by improving community capacities in managing climate shocks and risks through i) access to climate /weather information; ii) use of climate resilient livelihoods practices; iii) climate resilient assets protecting the community against climate related shocks; iv

projects.name: 2.5.10 Support to the establishment of a sustainable UXO Sector in Lao PDR .
projects.description: Strengthened the national ownership and greater resilience of the UXO sector in Lao PDR to ensure safe access and secure livelihood for the men and women left behind, including the persons with disabilities. Improved and increased coordination between Ministries, local authorities, and UXO clearance operators, which play an important role in assisting the government in the implementation of UXO clearance.

projects.name: 1.2.04 Support the elimination Plasmodium Falciparum malaria in the entire country and the elimination of all species of malaria in the 13 northern provinces
projects.description: In line with the Government of Lao PDR National Strategic Plan for Malaria (2021-2025); UNOPS, as the Principal Recipient for Global Fund RAI grant, supports the increased malaria service coverage for remote populations in border areas and other at-risk populations, as well as nationwide case management through public health facilities and health volunteers; in addition to the procurement and distribution of malaria commodities and strengthening of national surveillance systems. The program aims

projects.name: 1.2.24 Systems Capacity for Delivery of Quality Primary Health Care
projects.description: This sub-output aims to improve system capacity to provide direct service provision in targeted locations, expanding the coverage of quality primary health care complemented by a more resilient and sustainable community health approach, with special attention paid to underserved communities.

projects.name: 3.1.06 Strengthening Capacity and Effectiveness of the People's Assemblies in Lao PDR
projects.description: STEPS project is a five-year initiative that will strengthen Laos NA and PPAs and increase their ability to represent the interests of constituents, in particular women and vulnerable groups, hold the government accountable for their performance, and contribute to better policy and resource allocation informed by increased and more inclusive public participation and a better evidence base which will positively impact development outcomes

projects.name: JP2.5.09 Increased number of rural women and men, including persons with disabilities and LGBTQI, in decent, sustainable, and productive employment in selected target provinces and districts as result
projects.description: Support livelihood and employment opportunities for rural women and men, including people with disabilities, youth, returned migrant workers and LGBTI.

projects.name: 1.4.06 Systems Capacity For Delivery Of Convergent Nutrition Services
projects.description: This sub-output aims to enhance capacity in the five key systems – food, health, water and sanitation, education, and social protection – to deliver multiple, convergent, quality services across the lifespan. This involves leveraging human, technical, and financial resources from state, private, civic and academia entities operating within the five key systems to make them more responsive to improving the diets, services and practices for infants, children, adolescents, pregnant women and mother

projects.name: 1.3.03 Education And Learning Enabling Environment
projects.description: This sub-output aims to strengthen the enabling environment of the sector by ensuring there is capacity at national and sub-national levels to better plan, manage, coordinate, resource and monitor to improve sector performance. It also aims to ensure that the education system is resilient and effectively responds to emergencies.

projects.name: 4.3.09 Integrated Water Resource Management and Ecosystem-Adaptation project
projects.description: Promote the interventions of intergrated water resource  management, including forest and land and implementing intervetions of Ecosystem-based adaptaion to build resilience on communities and urban areas

projects.name: National Planning and Financing for Inclusive Development (NPFID)
projects.description: The National Planning and Financing for Inclusive Development (NPFID) focuses on addressing capacity gaps in aid coordination, data and statistics for monitoring, ODA monitoring through targeted capacity building assistance at technical and policy level. In anticipation of a larger whole of government and whole of UN programme that results from the experiences of the past two years, the project identifies outputs that will support the central roles of the Ministries of Planning and Investment an
projects.outcome: 2.2 Planning and Financing for the SDGs

projects.name: 1.4.05 Multisectoral Nutrition Enabling Environment
projects.description: This sub-output aims to improve good governance for nutrition, coordination of interventions as well as the adequate investment in nutrition through provide capacity development of the institution and administrative system for supporting accountability of governmental, civic and private sectors towards the provision of equitable quality nutrition services for children, adolescents and women. It will ensure transparency and accountability for prioritization, coordination and convergence of invest

projects.name: 1.2.10 Communicable diseases control and vaccine-preventable diseases
projects.description: WHO's support to Lao PDR towards ending infectious diseases such as vaccine preventable diseases, HIV/AIDS, hepatitis, tuberculosis, malaria, neglected tropical diseases and other communicable diseases.

projects.name: 1.2.11 Health emergencies and pandemic influenza preparedness
projects.description:
Supporting Lao PDR to strengthen capacities to detect, prevent and respond to health emergencies, mitigating the risk of high threat diseases and infectious hazards
detecting and assessing emergency health threats and informing public health decision-making, responding rapidly and effectively to emergencies under a coordinated incident management system and
ensuring WHO's work in emergencies is effectively managed, sustainably financed, adequately staffed and operationally ready to fulfil its mi

projects.name: 1.2.12 Health systems delivery including RMNCAH, HIS and HCF
projects.description:
Supporting Lao PDR to provide affordable health care for all. This also means ensuring that the care provided is people-centred, of high-quality and efficient.
Supporting Lao PDR to develop national health laws and plans. As plans are implemented, we work with countries to evaluate and refine programmes. We look at the capacity and number of health workers and engage local communities, so that tangible improvements to health services can be made. We also support countries in analysing and using

projects.name: 1.4.04 Crisis-affected populations in the Lao People's Democratic Republic are able to meet their food, nutrition and other essential needs during and after disasters. (WFP CSP SO 4)
projects.description: On request by Government, WFP will provide assistance (food and/or cash-based assistance) to targeted girls, boys, women and men affected by natural hazards or human-induced shocks and disruptions to meet their essential needs, ensuring equal benefits for women and men, people with disabilities and different ethnic groups. WFP will support the coordination of emergency food and nutrition response activities, including logistics assistance services and gender-sensitive and protection-informed eme

projects.name: 4.3.13 Building resilience of urban populations with ecosystems-based solution in Lao PDR
4.1.07 Building the capacity of the Lao PDR Government to Advance the National Adaptation Planning Process
projects.description: The four-year project aims to strengthen the institutional and technical capacity of the government and stakeholders at the national level and across 18 provinces of Lao PDR to advance the National Adaptation Planning process. This four-year project will increase institutional and technical capacity of stakeholders; develop climate information systems for prioritizing adaptation needs; mainstream climate change adaptation into social and economic development planning; and strengthen the capacity

projects.name: 1.2.25 Health Knowledge, Skills and Practices
projects.description: This sub-output aims to increase knowledge and skills among male and female caregivers to practice appropriate childcare, hygiene, feeding and early stimulation, as well as to demand quality services.

projects.name: 2.5.05 GCP/Lao/027/LDF Climate Smart Agriculture alternatives for upland production systems in Lao PDR (FSP)
projects.description: The objective of this project is to enhance resilience of vulnerable upland communities to climate change impacts through climate-smart agricultural practices in upland production systems.

projects.name: 3.4.12 Capacity Building to Improve Border Control Management Operations in Lao PDR
projects.description: The project aims to enhance the Lao PDR’s capability to improve border security, including interdicting contraband, drugs, wildlife and persons across international borders; and combating transnational crime, including financial crimes; and investigation. The activities include: (i) Design of a new multi-storey office building for the Lao Department of Customs and (ii) Planning, design, design review, construction and equipping of warehouses for the storage of contraband goods for the Lao Depart

projects.name: 3.5.04 Data, Evidence, PFM And Planning For Children
projects.description: This sub-output aims to contribute to an enabling environment for the wellbeing of the child by better positioning of children’s concerns, especially those of the most vulnerable children in public policies. This will be done by strengthening national capacity at national and sub-national levels to routinely generate disaggregated data and evidence on the situation of children, to use it for relevant analyses to inform the design of inclusive public policies and programmes and to monitor progres
projects.outcome: 3.5 Public Administration Reform and Data Driven Governance

projects.name: 1.3.05 Household - Learning, Knowledge Skills And Practices
projects.description: This sub-output aims to ensure that children, including adolescents and their families have access to the right information and programmes to enhance their knowledge and skills to demand for, and to contribute to improving the quality of education. Demand creation for quality education and beneficiary’s participation is key output which ensure the right knowledge and information to support children’s learning and overall development for them to help monitor delivery of quality schooling. It also

projects.name: 1.5.04 Systems Capacity For Delivery Of WASH In Communities And Institutions
projects.description: This sub-output aims to support Government to develop resilient, sustainable water supply designs, and work with government and the private sector to ensure that there are affordable, resilient, sustainable household sanitation designs and to assess the potential to make affordable household water treatment and MHM supplies of suitable quality available, even in remote communities.

projects.name: 1.2.23 Primary Health Care Enabling Environment
projects.description: This sub-output aims to improve capacity of health workers at national and subnational levels to increase accountability to develop quality of health legistlatation, planning and budgeting.

projects.name: 3.4.16 Enhancing Border Management Capacity in the Lao People’s Democratic Republic through Technology Improvement.
1.3.04 Systems Capacity For Delivery Of Quality Early Childhood And Basic Education
projects.description: This sub-output aims to strengthen the capacity of the MoES and key education service providers to support schools effectively and efficiently deliver quality education. It aims to ensure that schools have sufficient, qualified and committed teachers and school leaders; and that children have a conducive learning environment; and that there is effective monitoring of student learning outcomes with teachers equipped with knowledge and skills to provide immediate support to children lagging behind

projects.name: 1.2.05 Rehabilitation of the Mittaphab Hospital in Lao PDR
projects.description: With the aim of rehabilitating the Mittaphab Hospital (MH) to ensure that it can provide quality health care to patients, the following activities will be undertaken: (1) Coordinate with the MoH and hospital to validate the feasibility study completed in 2019 and revise the initially proposed scope of the rehabilitation and capacity building project; (2) Design, procure and execute the rehabilitation works as per UNOPS standards in sustainable health infrastructure; (3) Procurement and installat

projects.description: OSRO/GLO/113/EC Increasing capacities and scale for Anticipatoy Action including through social Protection systems

projects.name: 1.3.01 Strengthened national and subnational capacities to increase access of young people to gender-responsive sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights information, services, skills dev
projects.description: Comprehensive sexuality education in primary, secondary, TVET and higher education including awareness raising on mental health and psychosocial support implemented. Evidence based, gender-responsive and costed Nang-Noi Girls and Boys Groups programme implemented in selected provinces      with high adolescent fertility, high school dropout and high ethnic population to empower adolescent girls and boys.

projects.name: 3.4.02 Sustainable Alternative Development
projects.description: Introduce sustainable legal income alternatives to marginalized opium growing communities.. A particular focus is to introduce coffee as an alternative and establish a cooperative, market links and value adding capacities.

projects.name: 3.4.05 Anti-Money Laundering/Countering the Financing of Terrorism Programme.
projects.description: Provide capacity building, through a programme of training events, to enhance institutional compliance with internationally accepted best practice in the field of addressing AML/CFT, and to provide mentoring to improve the implementation and effectiveness of the aforementioned best practice by stakeholders (including the Office of the Supreme People's Prosecutor).

projects.name: OSRO/LAO/036/USA Global Health Security (GHS) Project - Technical assistance for animal health systems to address emerging and priority zoonotic diseases and health threats in Lao PDR
projects.description: Objectives: Strengthen animal health systems in Asia to reduce the risks and impacts of zoonoses, emerging disease threats, antimicrobial resistance (AMR) and biothreats through a One Health and inclusive approach.

projects.name: 1.2.03 Strengthened capacity of health providers to deliver high quality integrated comprehensive sexual and reproductive health information and services for all, with a focus on women and in priority
projects.description: Strengthened capacity of health care providers to provide good quality, integrated sexual and reproductive health information and services in health facilities and through telehealth modality, to all, including to adolescents and youth and the most vulnerable groups such as sex workers, people with disability, and those living in hard to reach areas.

projects.name: 1.1.05 Knowledge, Skills And Practices – Protection And Harmful Practices
projects.description: The sub-aim of the output is to provide parents and caregivers, as primary duty bearers, as well as children as rights holders, with the knowledge, skills, agencies and abilities along with a supportive community environment, to reject harmful practices (i.e. chlid marriage, child labour, corporal punishment, etc.), build on positive social norms, and adopt positive attitudes and practices (including birth registration) that protect children and reduce their risks and vulnerabilities. Activities

projects.name: 4.3.19 Government Capacity To Mitigate Natural Disaster And Climate Risks To Children
projects.description: This sub-output aims to strengthen capacity of government counterpart to implement disaster risk reduction (DRR) strategies and climate mitigation and adaptation, emergency preparedness and response, integrating behaviour change into health outreach programmes, equitable cost recovery and financing, developing multisectoral strategies and sectoral coordination.

projects.name: United Nations Coordinated Technical Assistance to the Government of Lao PDR on Green and Climate Finance
projects.description: Despite ambitious environmental and climate objectives, Lao PDR remains vulnerable to the impacts of the Triple Planetary Crisis and reliant on a growth model dependent on natural resource use. Recent economic and financial difficulties resulting from external and domestic factors have exacerbated the gap between Lao PDR’s ambitious environmental policy and resources available to implement this agenda. As recognised by the Government of Lao PDR and development partners at the January 2023 and Fe

projects.name: GCP /LAO/034/JPN-The project for Enhancement of Livelihood Resilience in Rural Areas
projects.description:
The overall Goal of the project is to contribute to poverty reduction, food and nutrition security and strengthened resilience of rural households in Lao PDR.
The project Outcome is the sustainable improvement of rural households’ incomes and livelihoods through climate-resilient, high-value agriculture and support infrastructure.

projects.description: LoCAL aims to promote climate change–resilient communities and economies by increasing financing for and investment in climate change adaptation at the local level in LDCs and other countries. projects.name: Readiness assessment on Laos' governance and financial mechanisms for implementing NDCs aligned with LTS
projects.description:
Lao PDR has set ambitious mitigation and adaptation targets in 2021 in the form of the Updated Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) and is expected to enhance these NDCs in 2025. It has solidified this commitment with detailed plans in the form of an actionable NDC Implementation Plan and a data-driven Long-Term Low Emission Development Strategy (LT-LEDS). This follows a series of national policies and plans aiming to transition Lao PDR towards a climate-resilient and low-carbon economy.

projects.name: 4.2.12 Technical and institutional capacity building interventions on Ebs for the reduction of climate change induced flooding (Under the “Building resilience of urban populations with ecosystem-based
projects.description: The project interventions aim to shift the paradigm of urban flood management in Laos from a limited, hard infrastructure approach towards an integrated approach that enhances climate resilience. This will be achieved by mainstreaming integrated flood management strategies into planning frameworks and implementing urban ecosystem-based solutions (EbS) to decrease climate-induced flooding

To achieve this objective, the project will undertake national analytical studies on opportunities and challenges of rural infrastructure (digital and transport) connectivity, and propose actionable strategies to strengthen rural infrastructure connectivity.

projects.outcome: 3.5 Public Administration Reform and Data Driven Governance

framework.name: People's Wellbeing
framework.description: By 2026, people, especially the most vulnerable and marginalized, will have more equitable and inclusive access to and will benefit from better quality health, nutrition, food, shelter, protection, water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH), and education and learning, including during emergencies.

children.name: 1 People's Wellbeing
children.description: By 2026, people, especially the most vulnerable and marginalized, will have more equitable and inclusive access to and will benefit from better quality health, nutrition, food, shelter, protection, water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH), and education and learning, including during emergencies.

children.name: 1.1 Protection
children.description: Strengthened multi-stakeholder capacities to prevent and respond to all forms of violence against women (VAW) and girls, children, migrant workers, and other vulnerable groups, across the development and humanitarian continuum.

children.name: 1.2 Health
children.description:
The government has increased health system capacity to provide affordable, resilient, sustainable, accessible, equitable and quality healthcare services, including immunization, Sexual, Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn, Child and
Adolescent Health (SRMNCAH), and prevention and control of communicable

children.name: 1.3 Education
children.description: Government and key stakeholders at national and sub-national levels and communities have enhanced capacities, knowledge, and resources to ensure children, youth and adults have access to and complete inclusive, equitable and quality teaching-learning and skills development programmes.

children.name: 1.4 Nutrition and food security
children.description: Government has strengthened capacity to plan, deliver and monitor sufficient and equitable quality nutrition-specific and sensitive interventions and services across sectors, and communities are supported and have the knowledge and skills to meet their food security needs and practice optimal dietar

children.name: 1.5 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)
children.description: Government has strengthened capacity to deliver and improve coverage and quality of WASH services, and people have increased knowledge and skills on their WASH practices.

children.name: 1.6 Shelter
children.description: Government institutions at the national and sub-national levels have strengthened capacity to provide access to appropriate, safe, serviced, and affordable shelter to all people, including the most vulnerable (such as internal migrants, internally displaced, and disabled).

framework.name: Inclusive Prosperity
framework.description: By 2026, people, especially the most vulnerable and marginalised, will benefit from more inclusive, and resilient, transformative, and sustainable socio-economic opportunities to reduce poverty and inequalities.
